channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Personal Website

item.title: Open spatial data for resilience in Tanzania: Lessons learned from 'Dar Ramani Huria'
item.description: Community Mapping For Flood Resilience ‚ÄúDar Ramani Huria‚Äù (Swahili for ‚ÄúDar Open Map‚Äù) is the name of a community-based mapping project in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. This project brought together international agencies, local university students and community members with the aim of putting the city‚Äôs most flood- prone areas ‚Äúon the map‚Äù for the first time, an endeavor made possible by the coordinated adoption of a host of geospatial and open data tools.

item.title: Sussidiariet√† e sviluppo: l‚Äôelettricit√† nelle favelas dell‚ÄôAmerica Latina
item.description: I prepared this blog post as a reflection on the experience as a graduate student and summer intern in a NGO working in Brazil Uno dei temi che hanno maggiormente animato il recente dibattito sulla cooperazione allo sviluppo √® la critica rivolta a governi e istituzioni multilaterali (Banca Mondiale, Fondo Monetario Internazionale e varie agenzie ONU in primis), di gestire gli aiuti ai paesi in via di sviluppo in modo arbitrario, assitenzialista e ultimamente inefficace (in sintesi con un approccio top-down).

item.title: Links to useful R resources
item.description: Here are some useful links and resources for R programming. General Rstudio Community: forum and discussions organized by macro-topic. Rseek: a sort of wiki R page! From rstudioconf2019: a collection of R resources by @littlemissdata Cheatsheets: self-explanatory WTF.. or “What They Forgot to Teach You About R” üòâ Another life-changing guide from Jenny Bryan Google’s R Style Guide Project Management Best Practices Handling Packages R-Bloggers blog (scroll to) reference: collection of links… analytical work reproducibly using R: Pre-print article Karl Broman slides Joris Muller’s Blog on The “ten simple rules for reproducible computational research” in R Joris Muller’s Blog on A basic reproducible data analysis workflow - principles R studio TERMINAL Great post Using rstudio-terminal/ More on Using the RStudio Terminal DATABASES Databases using R RStudio list API & R Amanda Gadrow Resources Saving tokens Various Ways Saving tokens WTF… to tell you ggplot2 & GRAPHS Great line by line tutorial ggplot flipbook Modern Dive Chapter Grammar of Graphics Table Packages to discover DataExplorer EDA, See github Formattable Tables, See more info table1 Tables, See more info ggstatsplot Graphs, See more info Extension of ggplot2 package for creating graphics with details from statistical tests included in the plots themselves and targeted primarily at behavioral sciences community.
